file_content.text: Republic and Imperial forces will be clashing around the capitol shortly. That's our best opportunity to remove you from sight.
You can rig a building with explosives and be caught in the firestorm. Fake your death and you'll no longer be top priority.
We need some place visible, but not a prime target--I'll need time to set up.
Let's go over the battle site.
How long have you been wanting to plot my demise?
Are you enjoying this?
Since the day you landed on Hutta. On and off.
For all his faults, I don't think Hunter is the gullible type.
They'll never believe that.
The enemy doesn't need to believe it--we just need it plausible enough to buy time.
There's an access tunnel beneath the Military History Museum, not on the official blueprints. Collapse the building and the tunnel is your escape route.
You'll need to move fast--I want you heading for the conspirators' hideout as soon as I find it. Good luck.
Secure comm channel open.
Uploading decryption program.
Twenty hours, thirty-two minutes. I thought I'd sent you to die.
I had to come back to you.
Don't worry. I'm okay.
You--well. Another success.
Twenty hours, thirty-two minutes. I really thought I'd made a mistake, but you're alive.
I spoke to Hunter and planted the information. Any sign they took the bait?
Mission accomplished.
You should know by now I'm not easy to kill.
Have some faith in me.
It's been a while--sometimes I forget.
It took a lot to plant that information. Is it working?
Just tell me it was worth it.
I'm seeing real activity in the conspirators' system--messages sent, credits transferred. I just need to make sense of it.
Meanwhile, it's time we got ready for the final play, but we can't meet so long as their eyes are on you.
I assume they've been tracking me since I left the airship.
Agreed.
You mean I can finally learn where you are and who you're with.
We're meeting up?
Once this is done.
If you didn't want the conspirators' attention, you shouldn't have sent me to their doorstep.
I think we're past hiding.
If I had more agents, this could've gone differently. But I don't.
There's no time for questions. The conspirators dismantled Intelligence because we were close to unraveling their plan.
They're exerting unprecedented influence on Corellia. You weren't transferred here by accident--you're here to discover their endgame and expose them before it's too late.
We'll have to catch up later, then. What do you have for me?
Tell me about their plan.
Who assigned me here? How did you recover from the holotrap?
That doesn't explain anything.
We still have a few allies. I can't name them here.
I should be serving a Dark Council member, not Lord Razer.
So I can blame you for this?
We all serve the Dark Council and through them, the Emperor.
You made me a lieutenant under Lord Razer!
So I can blame you for this?
The rank is meaningless, and Lord Razer isn't your problem.
The enemy is monitoring and manipulating military activity. They concealed news of those Republic reinforcements, and I suspect they're doctoring Imperial records, as well.
I need an unaltered accounting of our forces on Corellia--with real data, I can analyze why the conspiracy is pulling strings.
I've met some of the commanders, but I can't guarantee their information is good.
Could be tough.
We do have one source.
Did I mention how much I've missed you?
[Flirt] That's my girl.
If we survive, you can elaborate later.
You haven't lost your touch.
That's what you're best at.
Shall I count the troops by hand, or take holo-images?
I'm supposed to take a census?
Neither, thankfully.
The Dark Council recently sent Moff Zamar to perform a top secret accounting of every soldier, vehicle and weapon we've lost.
He's completed his tour and is taking a skyhopper to the spaceport shortly. Intercept him en route and acquire his report before the enemy can alter it.
I'll need the skyhopper route and some way of getting his attention.
Give me his coordinates.
If he's coming to the spaceport, that's the place to intercept him.
I should meet him here.
You'll never get close without causing a scene.
Bringing down a Moff's transport? What could be better?
This sounds like fun.
You can force his skyhopper to land by planting a series of false guide beacons around the Labor Valley battlegrounds.
Once he's grounded, his Imperial Guard escort will protect his ship while you locate him. Getting the report is up to you.
Let's hope he doesn't hold me responsible for his flight plan.
I'm on it.
Ground a high-ranking official in the middle of a war zone? There must be a better way.
We're putting him in danger.
Not in the time we have. I have faith you can ensure his safety.
I may have to take his report by force.
What if he's not friendly...?
There's a code word--"chromatic"--that might convince Zamar to cooperate, or it could raise suspicion. Do what you have to, and I'll be in touch.
Secure comm channel open.
Uploading decryption program.
It's good to see you again, Cipher.
It's good to see you, too. They didn't tell me anything after you were hurt....
I'm so glad you're okay.
I know. I'm sorry.
Here we are, Cipher. Together again.
Last I heard, you were brain-dead in a Kaas City clinic along with half our Watchers.
What happened to you?
You fall into a coma, and the whole galaxy goes mad. It's good to see you again.
Am I ever glad you're here.
It's good to see you, even under the circumstances.
In case you missed it, Operations was disbanded--and my designation retired.
I'm not a Cipher anymore.
Call it habit. I heard what happened during my absence, and I'm sorry.
